intro: Enchylaena tomentosa var. glabra, commonly known as the silky lily or silky tree, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It is characterized by its smooth, glabrous bark and broad, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in a waxy coating. The plant produces clusters of small, white or pale pink flowers that bloom in spring and summer. It thrives in warm, humid climates and is often found in lowland rainforests. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in tropical gardens.
